New Records: Jasprit Bumrah returned to international cricket after an 11-month injury lay-off and won the toss, opting to bowl first.
Ravi Bishnoi and Jasprit Bumrah each took two wickets apiece in the match.
Barry McCarthy scored 51 not out off 33 balls for Ireland.
Key Match Events: The match was interrupted by rain and eventually called off, leading to India's victory by 2 runs via the DLS method.
Sanju Samson stopped Craig Young from taking a hat-trick with a single on the first ball he faced.
Yashasvi Jaiswal scored 24 runs off 23 balls before being dismissed.
Ravi Bishnoi dismissed Paul Stirling for 11 and Harry Tector for 9.
Barry McCarthy hit a six off Ravi Bishnoi's delivery.
Pre-Game Insights: Jasprit Bumrah won the toss and opted to bowl first.
Ireland's Playing XI included Paul Stirling, Andrew Balbirnie, Lorcan Tucker, and others.
The pitch was known for pace and bounce, with an average first innings score around 170.
Post-Match Reflections: India won the match by 2 runs via the DLS method.
The match was a significant return for Jasprit Bumrah and included debuts for Rinku Singh and Prasidh Krishna.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was part of a three-match series, with India leading 1-0.
Ireland's batting order included Paul Stirling and Andrew Balbirnie, while India's included Ruturaj Gaikwad and Yashasvi Jaiswal.
Others: The match was the first T20I for several players, including Rinku Singh and Prasidh Krishna.
